body: And the demonlord's second coming was prevented because the saintess convinced the hero that she loves him (she does but still need that big, fake dick) and therefore reduce his negative feelings
Ok I read back, it's literally a sex doll type homunculus

And I didn't read the last parts so this just me arbitrarily guessing but did the saintess trapped the noble's soul in that amulet to be her personal sex slave? That was kinda a shitty end for a shitty person but has everyone got the bad end? Even the bad guy?

I feel like in this story god literally made it a zero sum game. The hero will defeat the demon king and be corrupted into the new demon king and the cycle repeats. The only true way to win is to not heavily rely on the hero and sacrifice a lot of soldiers, adventurers, knights, serfs and normal people and finally the hero does the killing blow. The only way for man to move forward, win and become more advanced is to learn from their past mistakes and not over rely on the hero. To truly unite mankind in one ultimate struggle for freedom. You might think I am over thinking this but this just reminds me of similar plots in novels I read before. The ones where the true enemy was actually your best ally all along type of developments.
